summary: Email exchange between FBI Assistant Special Agent in Charge Michael A. Osborn and an unnamed USAO (likely SDNY) prosecutor regarding scheduling a meeting to discuss the 'decision point on the death investigation' of Jeffrey Epstein. The meeting is set for the following Friday at 10am.

persons.name: Michael A. Osborn
persons.role: FBI Assistant Special Agent in Charge
persons.context: FBI official in New York who initiates the email to schedule a meeting with prosecutors to discuss the 'decision point on the death investigation' of Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Scheduled FBI-USAO meeting on Epstein death investigation
events.description: A meeting scheduled for the Friday after this email (September 13, 2019) between FBI officials and federal prosecutors to discuss the way forward and a 'decision point' in the death investigation of Jeffrey Epstein.

keyFacts: The email is dated September 6, 2019, shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's death on August 10, 2019.
The subject matter is a 'decision point on the death investigation' of Jeffrey Epstein, indicating ongoing federal scrutiny into the circumstances of his death.

The communication is between the FBI (Michael A. Osborn) and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (implied by 'USANYS'), showing coordination between investigative and prosecutorial arms.
The email chain shows a collaborative tone, with the prosecutor offering to host the meeting at their office.
